metadata.title: Kneecap Rapper Mo Chara Faces Terrorism Charge over Hezbollah Flag at London Concert

left: Mo Chara, known as Liam Óg Ó hAnnaidh, faces a terrorism charge for allegedly displaying a Hezbollah flag at a London concert in November 2024.
Kneecap denied the charge and stated they will 'vehemently defend' themselves against the accusation.
Prosecutor Michael Bisgrove clarified that the case does not concern support for Palestinians but rather the display of Hezbollah's flag.
During the previous hearing, it was reported that Ó hAnnaidh allegedly said 'Up Hamas, up Hezbollah' while displaying the flag.
center: Mo Chara, a member of the Irish rap group Kneecap, faces a terrorism charge for allegedly displaying a Hezbollah flag during a London concert last year.
Mo Chara, whose real name is Liam Óg Ó hAnnaidh, denies the charge and claims it is politically motivated to silence the group.
Supporters greeted Mo Chara with cheers and flags outside the court hearing where legal arguments were made to dismiss the case.
right: Mo Chara, also known as Liam Og O hAnnaidh, is facing a terrorism charge for allegedly waving a Hezbollah flag at a concert in London on November 21, 2024.
He allegedly said 'Up Hamas, up Hezbollah' during the performance while holding the flag.
His lawyers claim the charge was filed too late, as he was charged on May 22, 2025, after the six-month limit.
Prosecutor Michael Bisgrove argues that Chara was charged on May 21, 2025, which is within the time limit.
